item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives mean the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "We have come from God, and inevitably the myths woven by us, though they contain error, will also reflect a splintered fragment of the true light, the eternal truth that is with God. Indeed only by myth-making, only by becoming 'sub-creator' and inventing stories, can Man aspire to the state of perfection that he knew before the Fall. Our myths may be misguided, but they steer however shakily towards the true harbour, while materialistic 'progress' leads only to a yawning abyss and the Iron Crown of the power of evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If I were not a physicist, I would probably be a musician. I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Victor hugo
item.description: "Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent" -- Victor hugo

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Leonard Bernstein
item.description: "Music . . . can name the unnameable and communicate the unknowable." -- Leonard Bernstein

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Music has always been a matter of Energy to me, a question of Fuel. Sentimental people call it Inspiration, but what they really mean is Fuel. I have always needed Fuel. I am a serious consumer. On some nights I still believe that a car with the gas needle on empty can run about fifty more miles if you have the right music very loud on the radio." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination and life to everything." -- Plato

item.title: Kirsten add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Music is the universal language of mankind." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
